intro: Sphaeralcea incana, commonly known as hairy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Sphaeralcea incana is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun.
